content.description: In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn></math>, two blocks, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are connected by a string that passes over an ideal pulley, as shown. The mass of blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="m sub A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="m sub B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="m sub A is greater than m sub B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>. The two blocks are released from rest and allowed to accelerate.
content.question: While the blocks are accelerating in Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, which of the following forces must have a smaller magnitude than the tension in the string?

choices.label: Neither <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math> nor <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>
Only <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>
Only <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

Both <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

content.answer: Only <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
